en.title:
<size=50>Attack on Blob</size>
Mega Multiply
en.credits_desc: Made by: RENEGADEWARE, Music from: Kevin MacLeod
en.health_warning: Watch out! Once the health bar is empty, you will have to start over!
en.intro_dialog_1: Multiple space blobs have pierced through our dimension!
en.intro_dialog_3: We must banish them immediately before they fall down to Earth!
en.intro_attack_1: With our latest advancements in blobology, we will be deploying Attack Blobs.
en.intro_attack_2: These blobs must be made with the power of multiplication, and who better to do it than you!
en.intro_attack_3: Our intrepid hero, go forth, and use your mathematical might to banish these invading blobs for good!
en.lesson1_intro_1: Multiplying a number of two or more digits can be tricky, but there’s a special trick to make it easier!
en.lesson1_intro_2: Let’s take a quick look at a math concept that we will be using for this trick.
en.lesson1_distribute_1: By using the distributive property, we can split up the large number of an equation into smaller pieces.
en.lesson1_area_1: To help visualize this, we will consider these smaller pieces as chunks of a rectangle’s area.
en.lesson1_area_2: As you can see, the rectangle is split into two.
en.lesson1_area_3: Then we compute the area of those two rectangles.
en.lesson1_area_4: And finally, we add these two areas together to get the area of the whole rectangle.
en.lesson1_connect_1: Let’s give it a try. Connect these two blobs to initiate the attack!
en.lesson1_attack_distribute_1: Here we will be splitting the numbers up by multiples of 10’s.
en.lesson1_attack_distribute_2: Splitting up the numbers this way allows us to simply multiply single digit numbers, and just add the zeroes in the end.
en.lesson1_attack_distribute_3: Now click on the boxed number to split it!
en.lesson1_attack_eval_1: Here we will compute the product of each sub areas by using the numpad to type in the digits.
en.lesson1_attack_eval_2: Since we split them up nicely, we only ever have to worry about multiplying single digit numbers.
en.lesson1_attack_eval_3: Just remember to add the zero at the end for the number with the denomination of 10!
en.lesson1_attack_eval_4: Once you’re happy with the number, press the enter button.
en.lesson1_attack_sums_1: Finally, we add the numbers together to form the final product!
en.lesson1_attack_sums_2: Once again, use the numpad to compute each digit of the number.
en.lesson1_end_1: Excellent! As you can see, it’s much easier to solve an equation by splitting it up into smaller pieces.
en.lesson1_end_2: Now you are ready to banish the blobs!
en.lesson4_intro_1: Here we are at the final stage, with only a handful of blobs left to banish!
en.lesson4_intro_2: This time around, we will be multiplying double digit numbers.
en.lesson4_area_1: Just as we split the area up horizontally, we can also split it vertically.
en.lesson4_connect_1: Now why don’t you give it a try?
en.lesson4_attack_distribute_1: Just as you have done up to this point, simply click on the boxed numbers to split them.
en.lesson4_attack_eval_dd_1: This time around, you will be multiplying two double digit numbers.
en.lesson4_attack_eval_dd_2: Fortunately, they are both multiples of 10.
en.lesson4_attack_eval_dd_3: All you need to do is multiply the two non-zero digits, and put two zeroes at the end.
en.lesson4_end_1: Nice! Even with multiplying double digits, splitting them up allows you to solve them with ease!
en.lesson4_end_2: You will certainly have no problem dealing with the remaining blobs!
en.bonusBlob_2: Connecting with this blob will allow us to clear out the entire board, and give us a bonus score.
en.bonusBlob_3: Who knows what challenge awaits, so why not give it a try?
en.bonusBlob_4: However, you only have one shot. Do your best!
en.bonus_distribute_mixup_1: Looks like the numbers of each area are all mixed up!
en.bonus_distribute_mixup_2: Simply drag the numbers to their appropriate place, and once you are satisfied, press the PROCEED button.
en.bonus_distribute_mixup_3: Hint: If you look closely at the size of each rectangle, and its associated width, you will know where to put the numbers.
en.bonus_partial_products_1: Uh oh, some of the partial products are missing!
en.bonus_partial_products_2: Use the numpad to fill in the missing numbers, then press the left or right arrows to move to the next one.
en.bonus_partial_products_3: Once all the missing numbers are filled, press the ENTER button to proceed.
en.bonus_partial_products_4: Just remember how you split the numbers up into multiples of 10’s like before, and you should have no problem!
en.congrats_desc: All the blobs have been banished for good! Earth is safe once more!
